trans-unit.source: Serves as the base class for classes that contain HTTP-specific information about an individual HTTP request.
The <xref:System.Web.HttpContextBase> class is an abstract class that contains the same members as the <xref:System.Web.HttpContext> class.

The <xref:System.Web.HttpContextBase> class enables you to create derived classes that are like the <xref:System.Web.HttpContext> class, but that you can customize and that work outside the ASP.NET pipeline.
When you perform unit testing, you typically use a derived class to implement members with customized behavior that fulfills the scenario you are testing.
The <xref:System.Web.HttpContextWrapper> class derives from the <xref:System.Web.HttpContextBase> class.
The <xref:System.Web.HttpContextWrapper> class serves as a wrapper for the <xref:System.Web.HttpContext> class.
At run time, you typically use an instance of the <xref:System.Web.HttpContextWrapper> class to call members on the <xref:System.Web.HttpContext> object.
Initializes the class for use by an inherited class instance.
This constructor can only be called by an inherited class.
When implemented in a derived class, accepts an <xref href="System.Web.WebSockets.AspNetWebSocket"></xref> request using the specified user function.
The user function.
When implemented in a derived class, accepts an <xref href="System.Web.WebSockets.AspNetWebSocket"></xref> request using the specified user function and options object.
The user function.
The options object.
When overridden in a derived class, adds an exception to the exception collection for the current HTTP request.
The exception to add to the exception collection.
Always.
When implemented in a derived class, raises a virtual event that occurs when the HTTP part of the request is ending.
This event occurs before the <xref:System.Web.WebSockets.AspNetWebSocket> connection begins.
The HTTP context object.
The subscription token.
When overridden in a derived class, gets an array of errors (if any) that accumulated when an HTTP request was being processed.
An array of <xref href="System.Exception"></xref> objects for the current HTTP request, or `null` if no errors accumulated during the HTTP request processing.
Always.
When implemented in a derived class, gets or sets a value that indicates whether asynchronous operations are allowed during parts of ASP.NET request processing when they are not expected.
For more information, see <xref:System.Web.HttpContext.AllowAsyncDuringSyncStages%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
`false` if ASP.NET will throw an exception when the asynchronous API is used at a time when it is not expected; otherwise, `true`.
The default value is `false`.
When overridden in a derived class, gets the <xref href="System.Web.HttpApplicationState"></xref> object for the current HTTP request.
The application state object for the current HTTP request.
Always.
When overridden in a derived class, gets or sets the <xref href="System.Web.HttpApplication"></xref> object for the current HTTP request.
The object for the current HTTP request.
Always.
When implemented in a derived class, gets or sets an object that contains flags that pertain to asynchronous preload mode.
An object that contains flags that pertain to asynchronous preload mode.
When overridden in a derived class, gets the <xref href="System.Web.Caching.Cache"></xref> object for the current application domain.
The cache for the current application domain.
Always.
When overridden in a derived class, clears all errors for the current HTTP request.
Always.
When overridden in a derived class, gets the <xref href="System.Web.IHttpHandler"></xref> object that represents the handler that is currently executing.
An object that represents the currently executing handler.
Always.

When overridden in a derived class, gets a <xref href="System.Web.RequestNotification"></xref> value that indicates the <xref href="System.Web.HttpApplication"></xref> event that is currently processing.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.RequestNotification"></xref> values.
Always.

When implemented in a derived class, enables an object's <xref href="System.IDisposable.Dispose"></xref> method to be called when the <xref href="System.Web.WebSockets.AspNetWebSocket"></xref> connection part of this request is completed.
The object whose <xref href="System.IDisposable.Dispose"></xref> method must be called when the <xref href="System.Web.WebSockets.AspNetWebSocket"></xref> connection part of the request is completed.
The subscription token.
When overridden in a derived class, gets the first error (if any) that accumulated when an HTTP request was being processed.
The first exception for the current HTTP request/response process, or `null` if no errors accumulated during the HTTP request processing.
Always.

When overridden in a derived class, gets an application-level resource object based on the specified <xref href="System.Web.Compilation.ResourceExpressionFields.ClassKey"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.Compilation.ResourceExpressionFields.ResourceKey"></xref> properties.
A string that represents the <xref href="System.Web.Compilation.ResourceExpressionFields.ClassKey"></xref> property of the requested resource object.
A string that represents the <xref href="System.Web.Compilation.ResourceExpressionFields.ResourceKey"></xref> property of the requested resource object.
The requested application-level resource object, or `null` if no matching resource object is found.
Always.

When overridden in a derived class, gets an application-level resource object based on the specified <xref href="System.Web.Compilation.ResourceExpressionFields.ClassKey"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.Compilation.ResourceExpressionFields.ResourceKey"></xref> properties, and on the <xref href="System.Globalization.CultureInfo"></xref> object.
A string that represents the <xref href="System.Web.Compilation.ResourceExpressionFields.ClassKey"></xref> property of the requested resource object.
A string that represents the <xref href="System.Web.Compilation.ResourceExpressionFields.ResourceKey"></xref> property of the requested resource object.
A string that represents the <xref href="System.Globalization.CultureInfo"></xref> object of the requested resource.
The requested application-level resource object, which is localized for the specified culture, or `null` if no matching resource object is found.
Always.

When overridden in a derived class, gets a page-level resource object based on the specified <xref href="System.Web.Compilation.ExpressionBuilderContext.VirtualPath"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.Compilation.ResourceExpressionFields.ResourceKey"></xref> properties.
A string that represents the <xref href="System.Web.Compilation.ExpressionBuilderContext.VirtualPath"></xref> property of the local resource object.
A string that represents the <xref href="System.Web.Compilation.ResourceExpressionFields.ResourceKey"></xref> property of the requested resource object.
The requested page-level resource object, or `null` if no matching resource object is found.
Always.

When overridden in a derived class, gets a page-level resource object based on the specified <xref href="System.Web.Compilation.ExpressionBuilderContext.VirtualPath"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.Compilation.ResourceExpressionFields.ResourceKey"></xref> properties, and on the <xref href="System.Globalization.CultureInfo"></xref> object.
A string that represents the <xref href="System.Web.Compilation.ExpressionBuilderContext.VirtualPath"></xref> property of the local resource object.
A string that represents the <xref href="System.Web.Compilation.ResourceExpressionFields.ResourceKey"></xref> property of the requested resource object.
A string that represents the <xref href="System.Globalization.CultureInfo"></xref> object of the requested resource object.
The requested local resource object, which is localized for the specified culture, or `null` if no matching resource object is found.
Always.
When overridden in a derived class, gets the specified configuration section of the current application's default configuration.
The configuration section path (in XPath format) and the configuration element name.
The specified section, or `null` if the section does not exist.
Always.
When overridden in a derived class, returns an object for the current service type.
The type of service object to get.
The current service type, or `null` if no service is found.
Always.
When overridden in a derived class, gets or sets the <xref href="System.Web.IHttpHandler"></xref> object that is responsible for processing the HTTP request.
The object that is responsible for processing the HTTP request.
Always.
When overridden in a derived class, gets a value that indicates whether custom errors are enabled for the current HTTP request.
`true` if custom errors are enabled; otherwise, `false`.
Always.
When overridden in a derived class, gets a value that indicates whether the current HTTP request is in debug mode.
`true` if the request is in debug mode; otherwise, `false`.
Always.
When overridden in a derived class, gets a value that indicates whether an <xref href="System.Web.HttpApplication"></xref> event has finished processing.
`true` if the event has finished processing; otherwise, `false`.
Always.
When implemented in a derived class, gets a value that indicates whether the request is an <xref href="System.Web.WebSockets.AspNetWebSocket"></xref> connection request.
`true` if the request is an <xref href="System.Web.WebSockets.AspNetWebSocket"></xref> request; otherwise, `false`.

When implemented in a derived class, gets a value that indicates whether the connection is upgrading from an HTTP connection to an <xref href="System.Web.WebSockets.AspNetWebSocket"></xref> connection.
`true` if the connection is upgrading; otherwise, `false`.
When overridden in a derived class, gets a key/value collection that can be used to organize and share data between a module and a handler during an HTTP request.
A key/value collection that provides access to an individual value in the collection by using a specified key.
Always.
When implemented in a derived class, gets a reference to the page-instrumentation service instance for this request.
The page-instrumentation service instance for this request.
When overridden in a derived class, gets the <xref href="System.Web.IHttpHandler"></xref> object for the parent handler.
An <xref href="System.Web.IHttpHandler"></xref> object that represents the parent handler, or `null` if no parent handler was found.
Always.
When overridden in a derived class, gets the <xref href="System.Web.Profile.ProfileBase"></xref> object for the current user profile.
If the profile properties are defined in the application configuration file and profiles are enabled for the application, an object that represents the current user profile; otherwise, `null`.
Always.
When overridden in a derived class, specifies a handler for the request.
If you set `handler` to `null`, the default handler is used to process the request.
You can set `handler` to either an asynchronous handler or to an synchronous handler.
The handler must implement the <xref:System.Web.IHttpHandler> interface.
The object that should process the request.
A derived type fails to implement this method.
When overridden in a derived class, gets the <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest"></xref> object for the current HTTP request.
The current HTTP request.
Always.
When overridden in a derived class, gets the <xref href="System.Web.HttpResponse"></xref> object for the current HTTP response.
The current HTTP response.
Always.

When overridden in a derived class, rewrites the URL by using the specified path, path information, query string information, and a value that specifies whether the client file path is set to the rewrite path.
The replacement path.
Additional path information for a resource.
The request query string.
`true` to set the file path used for client resources to the value of the filePath parameter; otherwise, `false`.
Always.
When overridden in a derived class, rewrites the URL by using the specified path, path information, and query string information.
The replacement path.
Additional path information for a resource.
The request query string.
Always.
When overridden in a derived class, rewrites the URL by using the specified path and a value that specifies whether the virtual path for server resources is modified.
The replacement path.
`true` to reset the virtual path; `false` to keep the virtual path unchanged.
Always.
When overridden in a derived class, rewrites the URL by using the specified path.
The replacement path.
Always.
When overridden in a derived class, gets the <xref href="System.Web.HttpServerUtility"></xref> object that provides methods that are used when Web requests are being processed.
The server utility object for the current HTTP request.
Always.
When overridden in a derived class, gets the <xref href="System.Web.SessionState.HttpSessionState"></xref> object for the current HTTP request.
The session-state object for the current HTTP request.
Always.
When overridden in a derived class, sets the type of session state behavior that is required to support an HTTP request.
The <xref:System.Web.HttpContextBase.SetSessionStateBehavior%2A> method provides a base method that must be implemented by classes that inherit from this type.
ASP.NET implements this method in the <xref:System.Web.HttpContextWrapper> and <xref:System.Web.HttpContext> classes.
One of the enumeration values that specifies what type of session state behavior is required.
A derived type fails to implement this method.

When overridden in a derived class, gets or sets a value that specifies whether the <xref href="System.Web.Security.UrlAuthorizationModule"></xref> object should skip the authorization check for the current request.
`true` if <xref href="System.Web.Security.UrlAuthorizationModule"></xref> should skip the authorization check; otherwise, `false`.
Always.

When implemented in a derived class, gets or sets a value that specifies whether the ASP.NET runtime should call <xref href="System.Threading.Thread.Abort"></xref> on the thread that is servicing this request when the request times out.
For more information, see <xref:System.Web.HttpContext.ThreadAbortOnTimeout%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
`true` if <xref href="System.Threading.Thread.Abort"></xref> will be called when the thread times out; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `true`.
When overridden in a derived class, gets the initial timestamp of the current HTTP request.
The timestamp of the current HTTP request.
Always.
When overridden in a derived class, gets the <xref href="System.Web.TraceContext"></xref> object for the current HTTP response.
The trace object for the current HTTP response.
Always.
When overridden in a derived class, gets or sets security information for the current HTTP request.
An object that contains security information for the current HTTP request.
Always.
When implemented in a derived class, gets the negotiated protocol that was sent from the server to the client for an <xref href="System.Web.WebSockets.AspNetWebSocket"></xref> connection.
The negotiated protocol.
When implemented in a derived class, gets the ordered list of protocols that were requested by the client.
The requested protocols, or `null` if this is not an <xref href="System.Web.WebSockets.AspNetWebSocket"></xref> request or if no list is present.
